newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Sept 17.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Sept 17.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.

Vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission Zhang Zhen, on a visit to the mostly Moslem region of Xinjiang, urged strong unity between the army and the people and said all plots aimed at destroying Xinjiang's stability would fail.
A spokesman for Taiwan Affairs Office under China's State Council, or cabinet, accused Taiwan of bribing member states of United Nations to support the island's bid for re-entry into the world body.
China has issued regulations aimed at standardising share-holding companies.
The Ministry of Finance has issued rules governing financial problems arising from mergers of companies.
China has decided on the standards of selecting the fourth batch of companies to be listed overseas.

The State Council will adopt measures to strengthen financial reform in China's rural areas. The measures include giving the People's Bank of China, or central bank, control of rural credit institutions and increasing the number of branches of the Agricultural Bank.
China's demand for farm trucks in the next five years will reach 1.3 million, up from 350,000 this year.
